IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Our mission is to make it possible for everyone in our community, regardless of their background and resources, to be able to experience the joy of music and the artistic and intellectual benefits of musical, dance, and dramatic performance.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Founded in 1912, the Brooklyn Music School is a community music and performing arts education organization based in Fort Greene, Brooklyn. Since the schools inception, the school has been a proponent of arts education and the cognitive benefits of high quality music, dance and drama instruction and performance. Programs at the school range from an Outreach program throughout the boroughs of the City of New York to onsite culturally rich after-school and summer programs to traditional and non-traditional private lessons and group music classes. At the core of the Brooklyn Music Schools mission is accessibility to music and performing arts education regardless of resources or background, with the aim to make the next generation of people who love music and the arts.
IRS990.Desc: Private Lessons:For over one hundred years, the Brooklyn Music School has been offering high-quality music instruction featuring a world-class international faculty; offering the best of what New York City and the world have to offer. Private lessons at the Brooklyn Music School are intended to be encouraging, fun, engaging, and detailed in preparation for performance. All classes at BMS provide a warm, supportive and nurturing environment.Outreach:BMS Outreach program is designed to bring high-quality musical education, instruments, and programming into institutions where budget cuts or lack of personnel have resulted in either no musical instruction or programs with very limited scope. Currently, the school serves 3,000 people with 20 outreach partners. The curriculum will be customized to support the needs of each institution and disciplines continue to include chorus, percussion, guitar, recorder, violin, and keyboard, as needed.ARY:BMS after school program, Arts Reaching Youth (ARY), provides children from 5-12 years old with affordable, highly engaging performing arts and music immersion. World-class teaching artists will facilitate BMS variety of instruments, vocal expression, music theater, dance, music theory, and appreciation. Financial aid is available to low-income families who need a safe, affordable and stimulating place for their children to learn.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School does not believe its financial statements include any material, uncertain tax positions. Tax filings for periods ending August 31, 2015 and later are subject to examination by applicable taxing authorities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Part XII, Line 4b: Other revenue amounts included on 990 but not included in F/S
Schedule E, Line 3 - Racially Nondiscriminatory Policy Publicized
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School has a nondiscriminatory policy that is publicized in recruitment literature, flyers in public places, as well as print and electronic media. A copy of the policy is made available on our website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule E, Line 4 - Explanation of Records and Materials Not Maintained
Schedule E, Line 5 - Explanation of Organization Discrimination by Race
Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Management reviewed a draft of the form 990 with the audit/finance committee and provided edits to the tax preparer. After this process was performed, the form 990 was sent to the full board of directors prior to being filed with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization has a "board approved" conflicts of interest policy. Each board member and full-time employee must fill out an annual declaration stating they have no conflicts or identifying the nature of their interested party transactions. All potential conflicts are reviewed by the Governance Committee who issue written opinions and directives.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each year, the executive committee reviews comparable salaries based on a recognized study and reviews the performance of the executive director to determine if the existing salary falls within these ranges. After a deliberation of this matter, a new proposed salary and benefit package is reviewed and voted on by the full Board of Trustees. The minutes of the board of directors reflect the nature of this process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Documents are made available upon request.
